Call for Poster and Demo Papers

JIST 2018 Posters and Demonstration complement the full papers of the conference and offer an opportunity for presenting late-breaking research results, ongoing research projects, and speculative or innovative work in progress. Poster and Demo presentations allow researchers to present and to receive direct feedback from audience about significant work in progress, bleeding-edge work, or research that is best communicated in an interactive or graphical fashion.

We invite submissions relevant to the area of the Semantic Technology, which would address, but are not limited to, the topics of mentioned in the Call for Papers of JIST2018 full papers. Descriptions of ongoing / completed research work, reports on semantic software systems, "idea papers" (raising an interesting question or motivating an interesting line of research without already having solid results), position papers presenting a birds' eye view on some aspect of Semantic Technology in the sense of a meta-analysis, and PhD thesis abstracts are all welcome. Demonstrations are intended to showcase innovative Semantic Technology and related implementations. All submissions are intended to convey a scientific result or work in progress and should not be advertisements for commercial software packages.

All Poster / Demonstration papers will be reviewed. Accepted poster papers will be published in CEUR Workshop Proceedings and distributed to conference attendees, but will not be included in the JIST2018 LNCS post-proceedings. At least one author of each accepted paper must register for the conference and present the poster. Submissions must be in PDF format and no longer than 4 pages, using the style of the Springer Publications format for Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS). All submissions should be submitted via EasyChair system at https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=jist2018 (select the category of "Poster and Demo").

Important Dates

  • Poster and Demo paper submission: October 8, 2018
  • Poster and Demo paper notification: October 22, 2018
  • Poster and Demo paper camera-ready: October 29, 2018

Poster and Demo Chairs

  • Hanmin Jung, KISTI, Korea
  • Shinichi Nagano, TOSHIBA Corp., Japan
